name: electricity production, hydro, aluminium industry | electricity, high voltage, aluminium industry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11667/documentation

This is a dataset used to create an aluminium industry specific electricity market for 'aluminium production Area 7' (Oceania). The production volume represents the total amount of hydroelectricity used in the region for aluminium production (electrolysis and ingot casting). The dataset also identifies the technology and country providing the hydroelectricity in the region. ;Electricity markets specific to the aluminium-industry are needed in an LCI database because primary aluminium production is very energy intensive, and hence the location of production plants is often determined by access to large amounts of cheap electricity, which often results in an electricity mix that is different from the general grid mix of the countries where the production plants are located. ;It is assumed that the production of electricity in general and in aluminium industry specific power plants is identical. Details on actual electricity generation with each technology can be found in the corresponding datasets.;The share of hydroelectricity produced by the different technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage) is calculated using both (1) estimates of the share of hydroelectricity coming from each country within Area 7 (using country-specific aluminium production volumes and International Energy Agency data on electricity sources within each country) and (2) ecoinvent v3.2 country-specific split of hydroelectricity for AU. For NZ, hydroelectricity is assumed to be produced in non-alpine reservoir hydroelectric plants.;Calculations are detailed in the report 'Calculating grid mixes for the aluminium industry in ecoinvent v3', available on the ecoinvent website.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to start with the production of electricity.

Re-labelling dataset, not representing a real transformation activity. Conceptually, the activity can be said to end with a given amount of high voltage electricity labelled as specifically used for the production of electricity.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Production volume updated with 2015 data from IAI
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: For the split of hydroelectricity production to the respective technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage), sharess of different types of hydroelectric plants in the country, were used as a proxy for the split relevant for the aluminium industry, see general comments.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: IAI data used for total electricity used in the production of aluminium that is from hydroelectric plants. ecoinvent data used to split hydroelectricity production to the respective technologies (reservoir, run-of-river, pumped storage). The cited 100% representativeness is for IAI data (data based on 100% of regional aluminium production). The percent representativeness of data used to split hydroelectricity production to different types of plants (national grid proxy) is 36%: rest (ZE) based on an assumption.

exchanges.description: Expressed as sum of contributing technologies (inputs) to allow uncertainty analysis: each technology share is uncertain, and in a Monte Carlo analysis will always be normalized by the sum contribution of each technology

exchanges.description: Calculated amount (see general comments). Share of hydroelectricity used for primary aluminium production in Area 1 (Africa) that is produced in South Africa (ZA) and is assumed to come from pumped storage plants, based on the share of hydroelectricity produced from such plants in general in South Africa.
